tweet:
You may have noticed that we experienced some technical difficulties this morning with the livestream of our hearing on EPA’s IRIS Program. Thank you for your patience. We have now uploaded the full hearing to YouTube. 
Click below to watch! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RwGG587A67U&t=3s …

HAPPENING NOW
Subcommittee on Energy Markup of: H.R. 34, the “Energy and Water Research Integration Act of 2019” https://science.house.gov/markups/markup-of-hr-34-the-energy-and-water-research-integration-act-of-2019 …

"...there is more than ample justification for a standardized transparent approach to risk analysis useful to help moving forward decisions about regulation at the national and local levels."
-Dr. Bernard Goldstein

"The IRIS assessments are key to providing all available information & data to inform methods of reducing community members exposure and educate community members with the data they need to have a positive path forward to improve their health and quality of life."-Ms. Wilma Subra

"Another important reason for why the productivity of IRIS is suffering, in my personal opinion, is the lack of support to this program from EPA leadership. It is disconcerting to me that it appears that IRIS lacks sufficient financial resources & adequate staffing."-Dr. Rusyn

"EPA recognizes that the IRIS program still has work to do, and we are committed to addressing the recommendations made by the NAS and GAO."
-Dr. Jennifer Orme-Zavaleta

"...over the past 3 years, EPA's budget justification for human health risk assessment work, of which IRIS's budget makes up about half, was reduced to $22 million from its fiscal year 2017 budget of $40.5 million." 
-Mr. Alfredo Gomez

RELEASE: Chairwoman Johnson (@RepEBJ) and Ranking Member Lucas (@RepFrankLucas) Request Delay of 5G Spectrum Auction
 https://democrats-science.house.gov/news/press-releases/chairwoman-johnson-and-ranking-member-lucas-request-delay-5g-spectrum-auction …

"Given the sheer scope of the challenge we face in outer space, this is not something that the United States can address alone: it will require active collaboration and cooperation from our international partners." - Hon. Frank Rose

"Congressionally developed mechanisms to protect the long-range mission, with minimal setbacks between election cycles would be a huge step in assuring the continued US leadership in space." - @AstroPeggy

"Research both guides us where and how to look for answers to the questions we have today, and generates the questions we’ve never considered... Risk is what leads to great rewards - with investments in technologies that can keep us at the forefront of the world." - @EllenStofan

READ Chairwoman @RepEBJ's Opening Statement for Hearing on America’s Future in Space  https://democrats-science.house.gov/news/press-releases/chairwoman-johnson-opening-statement-hearing-america-s-future-space …
HAPPENING NOW → Hearing with @EllenStofan, @AstroPeggy, and Frank Rose on the future of America in space https://youtu.be/lNlchUVUUE0

"We know that our world is very closely connected in complex webs with the smallest forms of life. Emerging microorganisms, viruses, new vectors for disease all moving at the microscopic level, and all can be critical to human survival." 
-Dr. Laurie Zoloth

"In every field in which biological processes are used, engineering can be used to improve these biological processes in terms of the efficiency of the process or the value of the outcome." Dr. Sean Simpson

"In my own personal experience, when I discuss biofuels in the classroom, we consider not only the need for biofuels and bioproducts, but also the challenges associated with producing them in an economically and environmentally sustainable manner." - Dr. Eric Hegg

"Engineered biological systems already generate approximately 2% of US GDP on an annual basis. As biological engineering becomes more sophisticated and capable, it will have an increasingly broad impact on the economy." - Dr. @rob_carlson

"Because of their interconnections, saving water saves energy and saving energy saves water. Reducing the energy intensity of the water system and the water intensity of the energy system avoids environmental impact and improves infrastructure resilience."- Dr. @MichaelEWebber

"Through the Department of Energy’s Small Business Innovative Research program, we have developed non-wetting coatings and surface structures to improve condensation to more effectively remove heat from the steam circulating through power plant steam turbines."-Dr. Richard Bonner

"Rising water stress and water supply uncertainties due to climate change and increasing competition add new costs to the water- and energy-intensive water and energy systems for private and public owners alike."-Dr. @KateZerrenner

"Harnessing the research & development capabilities of our National Laboratories, academia, private industry & federal agencies, we can develop advanced water treatment technologies that make new sources of water cost competitive, reducing our reliance on freshwater."-Dr. Tidwell

"There must be strong and sustained investments in the people, facilities, and infrastructure that comprise our nation’s innovation enterprise. Without this support, our nation will lose its competitive advantage in the global marketplace..." - NAS President @Marcia4Science

This #WomensHistoryMonth we celebrate all women--particularly those in #STEM fields. Not only are women vital to boosting our nation’s global competitiveness, but they also play an influential role in inspiring and leading the next generation of scientists.
